meanings.definition: Preserve (a dead body) by embalming and wrapping in cloth.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians mummied their pharaohs to keep them safe for the afterlife.
meanings.sent2: She mummied the precious artifact in layers of protective cloth.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist accidentally mummied himself in toilet paper during the office prank.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to have mummied the old photograph, preserving the memories within.
meanings.sent5: The mummied cat in the museum display looked both eerie and fascinating.

meanings.definition: Wrap up in or as if in bandages.
meanings.sent1: The nurse mummied the injured arm to keep it stable.
meanings.sent2: He mummied the gift in colorful wrapping paper.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to mummy their friend in toilet paper for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The fog mummied the trees, shrouding them in a ghostly embrace.
meanings.sent5: She mummied her phone in a protective case to prevent any damage.

meanings.definition: To make or become shrunken and wrinkled, as if dried up.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the fruit out in the sun mummied it into a shriveled husk.
meanings.sent2: The old parchment had mummied over time, becoming fragile and yellowed.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich mummied in the lunchbox, turning into a sad, wrinkled mess.
meanings.sent4: The drought mummied the once lush garden, leaving it dry and withered.
meanings.sent5: The heat mummied the plastic toy, warping it into a distorted shape.
